cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 50 miles north of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across the central Gulf toward the Texas–Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Texas/Louisiana border (around Cameron-Lake Charles, LA)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Morgan City, LA to the Mouth of the Mississippi River (TS Watch); San Luis Pass, TX to Ocean Springs, MS including Lake Pontchartrain/Lake Borgne (Storm-Surge Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None affecting Plaquemines Port at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Louisiana coastline, greatest effects between High Island, TX and Morgan City, LA, including Plaquemines and the Mississippi Delta
weather_observation.wind: Increasing to tropical-storm force (25–40 kt) Wednesday afternoon and evening, with a low (4%) chance of 50-kt gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft inundation possible along the Plaquemines/Mississippi River Delta coast Wednesday night into early Thursday.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher totals possible, producing flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas in approaches to Southwest Pass, hazardous rip currents, and a slight tornado risk in outer rainbands.
